prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.
stories:
A US Army soldier stationed in South Korea has been detained in Russia, the US military says.

The Russian foreign ministry said the charges were not related to "politics or espionage", but to a "purely domestic crime".

The 34-year-old was not on official travel when he was held on 2 May in the city of Vladivostok, in Russia's Far East.

Sgt Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas, according to a statement from the US Army.

But instead of returning to the US, he travelled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said in a statement.

According to Russian media, he was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

The soldier's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that he was in Russia visiting his girlfriend.

"Please do not torture him [or] hurt him," Melody Jones said when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

He did not request official clearance and the defence department did not authorise his travel to China or Russia, the US Army said. There is no evidence he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian interior ministry informed the US embassy in Moscow on 3 May that Sgt Black had been arrested a day earlier for theft of personal property.

He is being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia".

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr Kirby said he could not provide more details.

Russia is holding two other Americans. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges.

Former US Marine Paul Whelan was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government says the charges against them are baseless.

A US Army soldier who was stationed in South Korea has been detained by Russian authorities, according to a statement from the US military.

Russian officials have said that the charges against the soldier are not related to "politics or espionage," but rather to a "domestic crime."

The 34-year-old soldier was not on official travel when he was taken into custody on May 2 in the city of Vladivostok, which is located in Russia's Far East region.

According to a statement from the US Army, Sgt. Black had been in the process of changing duty stations from South Korea to Fort Cavazos in the US state of Texas. However, instead of returning to the United States, he traveled through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons, US Army spokeswoman Cynthia Smith said.

Russian media reports have suggested that Sgt. Black was visiting a woman with whom he had a romantic relationship.

Sgt. Black's mother, Melody Jones, confirmed to CBS that her son was in Russia visiting his girlfriend. "Please do not torture him or hurt him," she pleaded when asked about her message to the Russians.

Sgt. Black enlisted as an infantryman in 2008 and was deployed to Iraq in 2009 and Afghanistan in 2013. He was most recently assigned to the Eighth Army, US Forces Korea at Camp Humphreys in South Korea.

The US Army has stated that Sgt. Black did not request official clearance for his travel to China or Russia, and that the Defense Department did not authorize his travel to those countries. There is currently no evidence to suggest that he intended to remain in Russia.

The Russian Interior Ministry notified the US Embassy in Moscow on May 3 that Sgt. Black had been arrested the previous day for theft of personal property.

Sgt. Black is currently being held at a pre-trial detention facility until his next hearing.

"The Army notified his family and the US Department of State is providing appropriate consular support to the Soldier in Russia," the US Army said in a statement on Monday.

National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told reporters that the US is "aware of this case and other matters related to Russia."

At the White House briefing on Monday, Mr. Kirby said he could not provide more details about the case.

Russia is currently holding two other Americans: Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, who has been detained since March 2023 on espionage charges, and former US Marine Paul Whelan, who was accused of spying and sentenced to 16 years in prison in 2020.

Both men maintain their innocence, and the US government has stated that the charges against them are baseless.

The soldier had recently returned from a deployment in South Korea and did not have the proper permits to enter China or Russia. Instead of returning to Fort Cavazos in Texas, the soldier decided to take a different route and travel through China to Vladivostok for personal reasons. On May 3, the Russian Interior Ministry informed the US Embassy in Moscow of the soldier's arrest, and they are currently being held at a pre-trial detention facility while awaiting their next hearing. The US Army has notified the soldier's family, and the US Department of State is offering consular assistance to the soldier in Russia. The US is aware of this case and other matters relating to Russia.
